Pre-Game Insights: Heimir Hallgrímsson wants a settled side, but admits that is tough to achieve.
Heimir Hallgrímsson has declared his desire to make Ireland a team that other nations hate to play against.
Heimir Hallgrímsson has picked 18 different players in his three starting-11s to date.
Heimir Hallgrímsson is looking for characters like Aron Gunnarsson, who steps up in all situations, a warrior.
Heimir Hallgrímsson is looking for players who step up in times of trouble, with technical ability and confidence.
Heimir Hallgrímsson thinks Greece could start on the front-foot and Ireland needs to improve from their last game and build on what they did the last time, and improve it for this one.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Greece drove the biggest of all the nails into the coffin of Stephen Kenny’s Ireland reign, in June of last year, by sprinting out of the traps.
Heimir Hallgrímsson has addressed a number of issues ahead of Sunday night’s clash with Greece at the Karaiskakis Stadium, home of Greek giants Olympiakos, in Piraeus.
Heimir Hallgrímsson is concerned that Greece could start strongly, as they did in their 2-1 win over Ireland in Helsinki 16 months ago.
Heimir Hallgrímsson wants to make Ireland a team that other nations hate to play against, but does not mention any specific players.
Heimir Hallgrímsson has picked 18 different players in his three starting-11s to date, and wants to achieve a more settled side.
Heimir Hallgrímsson is looking for players who step up in times of trouble, with technical ability and confidence, like Aron Gunnarsson.
Heimir Hallgrímsson thinks Greece could start on the front-foot and Ireland needs to improve from their last game and build on what they did the last time, and improve it for this one.
